result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Smith, Edward Cecil, Jr.

records.addlTxt: Order Regarding Investigator signed and filed.  bm

ADA Sam Tufford appeared after dates were set and advised he was unavailable on the December 12th Jury Trial date and requests new date.  ADA Tufford contacted Attorney Jochman and advised same.  Attorney Jochman does not object to adjournment.  Parties agree to December 5, 2022 at 8:30 am.  Final Pretrial date remains the same.  bm
Speedy trial demand.  Speedy expires December 22, 2022.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Edward Cecil Smith Jr.  Attorney Jessica Bellows for Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Defense also requests the Court authorize and Investigator.  Court grants request at the rate of $50.00 - $60.00 per hour with a maximum of $750.00 at this time.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court, defendant Edward Cecil Smith not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has discovery and requests adjournment to allow him time to review.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in court by video with Attorney Tyler A Jochman who appears in person.  Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Klauser. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Amended Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Notice of Retainer.  Received and filed.  nk

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in court with attorney Tyler A Jochman.  Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  The court appoints attorney Tyler A. Jochman to represent the defendant at county expense.  Defendant is not required to reimburse Milwaukee County.  Counsel accepts the appointment and is advised of the next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and filed.  nk
Case rescheduled for Hearing July 7, 2022, at 10:00 am.  State agreed to new Hearing date, via email.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with S.B. (DOB 02/28/2006)
K.B. (DOB 01/08/1981)
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of eighteen (18).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. 24 hour curfew. Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program Order for Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Edward Cecil Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward Cecil Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

contacted the Court to VACATE Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022. 
Defendant signed waiver. Governor's Warrant is no longer necessary.

Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm to address GOVERNOR'S WARRANT / EXTRADITION.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
